body:
If you need to use protobuf for some reason, I think the google.protobuf.Struct option is the best. If you don't need protobuf, the direct JSON serialization seems like the simplest solution.

I don't think your "JSON string in a proto message" is a good solution, because it has the inconvenience of double serialization without the benefit of protobuf's type safety.

Thanks for having this discussion. I'm in the exact same boat and this was helpful.

FWIW I'm using [grpc-promise](https://github.com/carlessistare/grpc-promise) to make RPC calls between Electron processes using ES6 async/await syntax. I don't care as much about being strict on data types, but gRPC + grpc-promise provides a really good API! In my renderer I can do

```jsx
const response = await backendClient.API().execute({ action: 'migrate' });
```

üëç Thanks for the time you put into working on gRPC.
